intro: Lamyra, commonly known as the mountain lily, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lamiaceae. These plants are native to various regions in the Mediterranean and parts of Asia. They are characterized by their showy, often fragrant flowers that come in shades of purple, blue, and white. Lamyra species typically have square stems and opposite leaves, which are typical features of the mint family. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
